meanings.sent1: The sokol soared high in the sky, searching for prey.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful sokol perched on a tree branch.
meanings.sent3: The sokol decided to take a break from flying and rested on a rooftop.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as sharp as a sokol's, always noticing the smallest details.
meanings.sent5: The sokol's wingspan was impressive, spanning almost the entire length of the room.

meanings.definition: A type of gymnastic society in Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent1: The sokol group practiced their gymnastic routines in the park.
meanings.sent2: My cousin is a member of the local sokol club.
meanings.sent3: During the sokol performance, one of the gymnasts did a funny somersault.
meanings.sent4: The sokol's dedication to fitness was as strong as their muscles.
meanings.sent5: The sokol's gymnastic display left the audience in awe of their skills.

meanings.definition: A surname of Czech, Slovak, and Polish origin.
meanings.sent1: Mr. Sokol was a well-known artist in the community.
meanings.sent2: The Sokol family reunion was a joyful event with lots of food and laughter.
meanings.sent3: When the teacher called out 'Sokol' during attendance, three students raised their hands.
meanings.sent4: The Sokol name carried a legacy of creativity and talent.
meanings.sent5: The Sokol surname was proudly displayed on the family crest.
